hZJayFF4T6qRNFiGS_0How.text: Friendly service! I missed out on their special combination and they are willing to change my order. I'm so grateful. There's sufficient staff to meet customers' needs as the crowd builds up during lunch time. Food is yummy and fast service. So glad that Yelp provided this option for me. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Part 1 of their menu. There's lots to choose!

U5GAoSBAi7d4Psb9bgA1wA.text: Really cool place. Can order entire meal from an iPad. Cash only. Affordable. Don't get the egg rolls - they're not good. Red curry is fantastic, beef is a bit chewy though.

photos.caption: Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Egg rolls. They are not good.
Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Red curry with rice and a fried egg.

yWZfMxczVFwVKMHgqhDLZw.text: Was not feeling the best so came here for some rice. Outstanding. Will come back later in the week when I am feeling better and give it a true test. Sure it will be great.

lv1Nq_NS0tACxs6zbzCmwg.text: I used to visit Jai Thai at Katong for lunch when I worked in that area. After changing jobs, I really miss their Pineapple rice sets that comes with a generous serving of other sides at a total cost of $8.90++.The restaurant serve authentic thai food and it's really a delight to indulge. Another one of my favourite is their tapioca dessert which fortunately did not run out the evening I was there. The tapioca was sweet and warm with a generous amount of coconut milk.With Purvis Street near my current work place, I should be coming back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. The pineapple rice set!

IpO4468TwffByLJcO7G6BA.text: Simple restaurant with superb authentic taste of Thai. The green curry fried rice brought my memories back to the beautiful yet hot Bangkok on my last holiday. The mango salad was truly full of sour spicy freshness. However the Pad Thai was bland. The waitress was really nice and smiley. Prompt service! Sure I wold come by again if I am around Little India.

eeLG13Kmjuu0jTVw8hJ97A.text: Value for money this food. I've tried the one at clover and this is my first time here :) it was a very hot day and the red ruby drink is an absolute treat. Although I would order it will less ice, else it would be like an ice kachang. The pad Thai at $5 is a steal! It's so delicious and big enough to share!

photos.caption: Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. $3.50 red ruby!
Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Pad Thai $5! :)
Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore

v-3bhyGSfx8DIGEVptmb_Q.text: Very good taste, Tom yum soup was very fresh, green curry was nice, even the warm beer did not matter (and I like beer)5 people for 135 SGD is a steal

x1Wsns823UY0jrVRtHygXA.text: I used to dine here a lot because I thought the food was good. Today, I was appalled by their service. While I was enjoying my dinner with a close friend, a service staff interrupted our conversation to inform me that no outside drinks were allowed. And she pointed to my Nalgene bottle that was filled with tap water. Not only was the comment ridiculous and unnecessary, it ruined our mood for the rest of the evening. I also noted that their menu had Tissue paper listed as a purchasable item. And no, they don't provide a single napkin with your food. What a ridiculous and cheapskate eatery. Food wise, it was mediocre. Especially the green curry.

xT90sRrYRF4G1aXs9NaInA.text: Okay, not great. The food lacked passion and was kinda weak. The curry was kinda cold and the food was kind of bland. Not what I was expecting. Feels cheap and very budget.

Q3X8m9eE-YLg6yjPdfzB-A.text: Nice and authenic Thai food and reasonably priced. Managed by Thai also. Ambient may not be decorated but who cares when we are looking for good taste.

gpYW4Rzv_PmyOZEG0UBUEQ.text: If you want something spicy, affordable and delicious.. Jai Thai is the place for you.They have an all day set menu ($12 and below). I am quite partial to their green curry rice set which comes with a bowl of rice, a bowl of green curry filled with ingredients, traditional Thai dessert of the day and a cup of drink. If you have a bigger stomach, you can try their pineapple rice set which comes with a plate of pineapple rice and a sample platter of their green curry, one spring roll, one pandan chicken, sweet and spicy fish. It also comes with their dessert of the day and a cup of drink. For the price you pay, I'll say it's worth it. Their pandan chicken well, it's amazing. I love it. It's $2 a piece but hey, it's pretty big. Do give Jai Thai a try if you are around the Purvis Street area!

photos.caption: Photo of Jai Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Pandan Chicken

bohgQZpzK6c0HFDy8tNakA.text: Prawn cakes/fish cakes are a must for a starter.Followed by green curry, phad si euww. All the food here is pretty affordable, but also small portion, so just have to order more to fill up :) I didn't think the pineapple fried rice was any good. You could give it a try and let me know what you think though. I will come back to try other dishes.

SWhe6TtO6sOUO1MZfy91FQ.text: My other go-to Thai place in Singapore and it is really near my office. I eat here during lunch and always order ala carte. I get that most office folks dig the set lunches which come in these flower shaped platters, but I prefer ordering 3-4 dishes (portions are more than adequate) with friends and it works out to about the same price. Food here is pretty close to what you'd get in Thailand.The fish and prawn cakes here are handmade and fried fresh, just like at Joe's Thai. The tom yam soup is authentic and therefore searingly spicy. Even for someone who comes from a line of chili kings & queens, Jai Thai sometimes gives me a stomach ache afterwards from the spiciness so I usually ask them to tone it down a bit. I also like the steamed tofu with basil chicken, which is a different take on the usual Thai basil chicken. Their prawn tung hoon (which is one of my barometers of a good Thai cook, along with beef soup and fried duck) is darn good too. Basically, I haven't found any dish that wasn't to my liking. Prices are ridiculously cheap but don't tell the restaurant that. Service is hit or miss and if you reach there any later than 12.30pm on a weekday and aren't willing to share a table, go look somewhere else because this place is always packed.

l7_wk4XOb9l6KiAydJh5Uw.text: A personal favourite :) go quite a lot after work. Decent good cheap Thai food that is pretty authentic! I like the green curry, the fried rice with basil leaves, the Kai Lan and many others. mylifeinsin.com/2013/01/…

VgVnpvhIILUjiYxwcaDziA.text: Craving for Thai food after class one day, I decided to head down to a Jai Thai outlet at Purvis Street since it was nearby. My friends had good reviews about the place, saying the food there was good and cheap so I agreed to give it a try. I ordered the Phad Thai since it is a Thai dish that can determine the standard of a good Thai restaurant. The dish was so fragrant that I could smell it the moment they brought it out of the kitchen. To my surprise, the Phad Thai was flavorful and fulfilling. The dash of lime balanced the sweetness of the dish and made it perfect. Also, it was not dry like how most Thai restaurants do it, so it was really palatable. The prawns were fresh, crunchy and succulent, while the little bits of egg were really tasty. The service was good, as the staff was warm and hospitable. I would probably go back again whenever I need a quick fix for a Thai food craving.

dXRvJfPmWF4oBWLwB19iKg.text: Nice hole in the wall with great food. I liked that is added some spice to my life. I love that you order like a sushi menu. Great prices considering a Singapore sling at the raffles long bar next door is 30 sing and is less then 2 blocks away. And the food was amazing. Great pad Thai and spring rolls.

kcFix7-lEpqFE7OKq6_ffA.text: For my money it's one of the best Thai restaurants in town - a (really) extensive menu, great tasting food, and relatively cheap prices in a clean, casual environment.  My favorite dishes are the fish cakes, tofu with basil chicken, and pandan chicken.  The tamarind prawns are also a fave.  I haven't had a dish here that didn't taste good.
